info.name: KaBuM API Testing
info.description:
# KaBuM API Testing (Unofficial, for QA Learning)

> **Purpose:** Practice API testing against publicly reachable endpoints that power the **kabum.com.br** website (search, listing, product page, etc.).  
**Scope:** Read-only checks (availability, latency, basic parsing). **Do not** brute force, bypass auth, or violate the site‚Äôs Terms of Use. 
  

---

## üîé Overview

This collection exercises a few HTTP GET flows that are visible in the browser‚Äôs Network tab:

- **Landing page availability** ‚Äì quick uptime & latency check
    
- **Search** ‚Äì returns HTML (and sometimes background JSON/XHR). Validate status, response time, and simple content checks.
    
- **Product detail** ‚Äì follow a product link/SKU captured from Search to verify detail pages load.
    

Extend with your own captured XHR/JSON endpoints from DevTools. All sensitive/account flows must be tested only with your **own** test account and within allowed terms.

---

## üåê Base URLs & Environments

Create a Postman **Environment** and add:

| Variable | Example | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `base_url` | `https://www.kabum.com.br` | Main site (HTML pages) |
| `api_base` | _(optional)_ | Fill if you discover JSON/XHR endpoints in DevTools |
| `user_agent` | `Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64)` | Use a realistic UA if WAF blocks defaults |
| `accept_lang` | `pt-BR,pt;q=0.9,en;q=0.8` | Localized content |
| `q` | `ssd` | Default search query |
| `sku` | _(auto-set by Tests)_ | Captured from search HTML to chain into product page |

---

## üîê Authentication

Public pages (landing, search, product detail) **do not require auth**.  
If you explore account/cart/checkout APIs, use **your own test credentials**, store as env vars (e.g., `kb_email`, `kb_password`), and obey rate limits & terms. Avoid storing secrets in the collection.

---

## ‚è±Ô∏è Rate & Usage (self‚Äëimposed for safety)

- Max **10 requests/min** during practice runs
    
- Single thread (no parallel bombing)
    
- Respect `robots.txt`, cache headers, and any 4xx/5xx back‚Äëpressure
    

If blocked by WAF (e.g., **403 Forbidden**), back off and stop the run.

---

## üì¶ Common Headers

Add these to requests (collection level or per‚Äërequest):

```
Accept: text/html,application/json;q=0.9
Accept-Language: {{accept_lang}}
User-Agent: {{user_agent}}
Referer: {{base_url}}/
Connection: keep-alive

 ```

---

## üß™ Reusable Tests

Paste into a request‚Äôs **Tests** tab as needed.

``` javascript
pm.test("Status is 200", () => pm.response.to.have.status(200));
pm.test("Responded within 2000 ms", () => pm.expect(pm.response.responseTime).to.be.below(2000));

 ```

**Search HTML ‚Üí capture first SKU (adjust regex after inspecting markup):**

``` javascript
const html = pm.response.text();
pm.test("Contains site brand text", () => pm.expect(html).to.include("KaBuM"));
// Example pattern ‚Äì update to match current DOM attributes/classes
const m = html.match(/data-sku=["']?(\d{5,})["']?/);
if (m && m[1]) {
  pm.environment.set("sku", m[1]); // or pm.collectionVariables.set("sku", m[1])
  console.log("Captured SKU:", m[1]);
} else {
  console.warn("SKU not found; update regex to match current markup.");
}

 ```

**JSON schema guard (use on JSON/XHR endpoints):**

``` javascript
pm.test("Valid JSON", () => {
  pm.expect(() => pm.response.json()).to.not.throw();
});

 ```

---

## üìö Requests in this Collection

### 1) LandingPage ‚Äì Availability

- **Method:** `GET`
    
- **URL:** `{{base_url}}/`
    
- **Tests:** `200 OK`, contains ‚ÄúKaBuM‚Äù, `responseTime < 2000ms`.
    

**Optional extra test:**

``` javascript
pm.test("<title> includes KaBuM", () => pm.expect(pm.response.text()).to.match(/<title>.*KaBuM.*<\/title>/i));

 ```

---

### 2) Search items (HTML search)

- **Method:** `GET`
    
- **URL:** `{{base_url}}/busca/{{q}}`
    
- **Variables:** `q` ‚Äì e.g., `ssd`, `monitor`, `gpu`
    
- **Purpose:** Validate search page loads; harvest a SKU for chaining.
    
- **Tests:** `200 OK`, body contains product grid text; regex captures first `sku` into env `{{sku}}` (see test snippet above).
    

> **DevTools tip:** In Chrome DevTools ‚Üí Network, filter **XHR/fetch** while searching. If you find a JSON API used for search/autocomplete/product list, copy its full URL and add it below as a JSON request under `{{api_base}}`. 
  

---

### 3) Product detail (HTML)

- **Method:** `GET`
    
- **URL:** `{{base_url}}/produto/{{sku}}`
    
    - _(If the site uses slugs, replace with discovered pattern, e.g.,_ `_/produto/{{slug}}_`_.)_
        
- **Pre‚Äëreq:** `{{sku}}` set by Search test, or provide manually.
    
- **Tests:** `200 OK`, body contains ‚ÄúAdicionar ao carrinho‚Äù or product title text.
    

**Example body check:**

``` javascript
pm.test("Detail page shows buy CTA or title", () => {
  const b = pm.response.text();
  pm.expect(b.includes("Adicionar ao carrinho") || /<h1[^>]*>.*?<\/h1>/i.test(b)).to.be.true;
});

 ```

---

## üîÅ Mini‚ÄëWorkflows

**Availability sweep**

1. Run _LandingPage ‚Äì Availability_ 10√ó with \~5s delay.
    
2. Confirm p95 < 2s and no 5xx.
    

**Search ‚Üí Product chain**

1. Set `q = "ssd"`.
    
2. Call _Search items_ (captures `{{sku}}`).
    
3. Call _Product detail_ using `{{sku}}`.
    
4. Assert both return 200 and expected keywords.
    

---

## üß© Pre‚Äërequest Script (optional helper)

Randomize search terms per run:

``` javascript
const terms = ["ssd", "monitor", "teclado", "mouse", "headset", "fonte", "gabinete"];
pm.environment.set("q", terms[Math.floor(Math.random() * terms.length)]);

 ```

---

## üöß Errors & Troubleshooting

- **301/302** ‚Üí Ensure `https://` and accept locale redirects.
    
- **403** ‚Üí Likely WAF. Slow down, use realistic headers, include `Referer`, avoid loops.
    
- **429** ‚Üí Too many requests; add delays and reduce iterations.
    
- **Regex fails** ‚Üí Update SKU selector after inspecting current HTML.
    

---

## üìé JSON/XHR Endpoints You Discover (fill-in)

Document real JSON endpoints you capture from DevTools here:

**Search API (placeholder example):**

```
GET {{api_base}}/catalog/search?q={{q}}&page={{page}}&size={{size}}

 ```

**Returns:** JSON list of products with `id/sku`, `name`, `price`, `availability`.  
**Tests:** 200 OK, valid JSON, length > 0, store first `id` as `{{sku}}`.

**Product API (placeholder example):**

```
GET {{api_base}}/catalog/products/{{sku}}

 ```

**Returns:** JSON detail; validate `status`, `price`, `stock`.

---

## üì£ Legal/Ethical Use

This is an **unofficial** practice collection. Use responsibly for education/QA learning, follow KaBuM‚Äôs Terms of Use and robots/security controls, and never overload or scrape aggressively.

---

## üìù Changelog

- **v0.1 (Sep 2025):** Initial availability, search, and product detail flow with regex SKU capture.
    

---

### How to Use

1) Create an Environment and add variables above.  
2) Paste this entire Markdown into your Postman collection‚Äôs **Documentation** pane.  
3) Start with _LandingPage ‚Äì Availability_, then _Search items_, then _Product detail_.

**Bangla+English quick note:** Eita copy‚Äëpaste kore Postman docs‚Äëe dao. Age `{{base_url}}` set koro, tarpor _Search ‚Üí Product detail_ run koro. Jodi JSON API pao DevTools theke, ‚ÄúJSON/XHR Endpoints‚Äù section‚Äëe real path likhe nao.
